ygData.subject: RE: Norrathian Lore: Nagafen's Lair
ygData.msgSnippet: Why would they?  No idea, but seeing those frog-like white things instantly made me think of frogloks and seeing the dead one with yellow eyes only made it
ygData.messageBody:
Why would they? No idea, but seeing those frog-like white things instantly
made me think of frogloks and seeing the dead one with yellow eyes only made
it more so. Maybe the froggies and goblins had a war long ago? Or the
froggies and kobolds? Maybe that's how the undead frogloks got created and
that's why the live ones hate them? I'm just saying those white guys look
like frogs to me, and the yellow eyes just reinforced that impression.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan Honeyman [mailto:honeyman@...]
Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 2:48 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Norrathian Lore: Nagafen's Lair


From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>

> I think I can answer some of this, and am surprised you didn't spot it too
> with all the time you spend there. The white critters are frogloks I
> believe. The one with the glowing eyes is perhaps the first undead
froglok?
> Their eyes are a glowing yellow as I recall. Did they have a war with the
> kobolds perhaps?

Why would the kobolds paint frogloks on their walls? As far as I
can tell, I don't think the kobolds know anything about frogloks.

I think goblins, firegiants, kobolds, and nagafen are portrayed.
But who is who is hard to tell, besides the big dog Nagafen. If
in fact it is Nagafen, it may not be.

Harmonic.
